result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey R Cornelius was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--To pay costs of $243

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Motion and Proposed Order for the Destruction of Firearm and/or Ammunition
Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 1:38 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Corey R Cornelius in court with Attorney Colleen J. Locke. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3
Sentencing arguments by Counsel; Court has colloquy Rosemary Cornelius

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription & take all medications as prescribed
--Continue course of treatment recommended through VA
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--No possession of any firearms

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
SCRAM may be removed today
DA Happ reviews 968.20(1m)(b) which states weapon shall be disposed of
Recess:  2:00 pm
Attorney Colleen Locke

ADDRESS INFO for Corey R Cornelius
Current: 924 Peterson St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2014)
Prior: 328 Grant St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

Case called at 2:26 pm [Clerk SH] (On Defense Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Corey R Cornelius in court with Attorney Colleen J. Locke. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments presented by Counsel; Statements by Rosemary Cornelius
Court has colloquy with Ms. Cornelius

Court presents basis and grants defense motion to modify bond, and requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Rosemary Cornelius unless in the confines of counseling, in the counseling office and as long as the counselor is asking the questions and is present
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 8/28/2014 at 3:00 pm.
-No possession or consumption of alcohol to include mouthwash or cold medicine
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession of dangerous weapons
-No possession of any ammunition
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons
-Defendant may have contact with Rosemary Cornelius and reside with her only after SCRAM is installed

Court reminds parties of upcoming court dates
Recess: 2:45 pm 

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled for DA PTC & STC
Motion hearing on August 28, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Affidavit in support of motion dismissing no contact order
Defense motion dismissing no contact order
Status conference on September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 3, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:23 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Corey R Cornelius in court with Attorney Colleen J. Locke. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Locke: Requests matter be set for DA PTC and STC and to enter pleas of Not Guilty on charges & to waive speedy trial 
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Beck indicates that the State is not aware of any bond violations
Court reminds Mr. Cornelius that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 9/3/14 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule STC  9/19/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on August 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Corey R Cornelius appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession of dangerous weapons or ammunition
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with Rosemary Cornelius
-Appear at STC on 8/15/14 

Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Cornelius is not eligible for SPD Representation, but have provided him with petition for Court appointed Counsel
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Recess: 2:26 pm 

NEXT: (1) STC scheduled for at 8/15/14 at 1:15 pm - Send notices **INQUIRE OF COUNSEL STATUS**
